title: Frontend Engineer - Fast-growing startup HR-Tech
description:
Workfully is building a B2B marketplace for independent recruiters and the world's most innovative companies. We aim to change the recruitment service industry ($700bn market) by creating a decentralized platform empowering top recruiters to go solo, engage, manage, grow, and monetize their talent pools.




Our ultimate vision is to provide everyone with unprecedented access to opportunity.




The company was founded in mid-2021, reached 1M€ in yearly revenue in 2022, and now looking to build products faster and grow x4 throughout 2023.




In this context, we're hiring for a Frontend Engineer, someone who will have the privilege to shape the UI and Fronted architecture of our product reporting directly to our CTO & Co-Founder.




What You Will Be Doing




 * Design, develop, and maintain the frontend of our product using React
 * Collaborate with the team to implement new features and improve user experience
 * Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code
 * Participate in code reviews to ensure high-quality standards
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest frontend technologies and best practices




Who You Are




 * 4+ years of experience in Frontend Development, with a focus on React
 * Strong understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
 * Experience developing UI mockups with Figma
 * Experience with Git, webpack, and other frontend development tools
 * Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
 * Good communication and teamwork skills
 * Strong understanding of user-centered design principles




Why should you join?




Joining an early-stage startup is not for everyone. The bad sides? Working in an uncertain environment, lots of pressure, and the need to ship features fast.




The good sides?




 * Build something from the ground up
 * Have a real impact in product/company decision
 * Grow with the company and have a direct impact on the world through our vision
 * Get equity after 6 months as a founding engineer
 * Flexible working (from home, office, or wherever you want to work)
 * Work with smart people from different countries
 * A starting salary between 40K€ and 60K€ depending on experience

title: Software Engineer
description:
A stellar opportunity to make a massive impact: push the boundaries for how Happy.Rentals customers find the best possible vacation rental for their trip. Our Supply Connectivity team is responsible for reliably connecting our customers to diversified sources of vacation rental home inventory so that we can always offer the best possible deal to our users at the best possible price.




As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for scaling, improving and operating our direct integrations platform with large channel managers, property management systems, OTAs, and other partners across the board.




You’ll work with a highly skilled team of technical, data and product-focused individuals, whose mission is to consistently find and deliver the best vacation rental home deals and inventory for our customers. We are looking for team members with strong backend engineering, API, and analytical skills. Everything we do is focused on customer experience, data measurement and delivering value at speed. You’ll be responsible for making that a reality.




Requirements




 * 3+ years professional experience building and maintaining systems at scale
 * Experience in building and managing multiple external API integrations
 * Professional experience developing data heavy platforms or APIs
 * Thrived in backend engineering positions and delivered user experiences at scale
 * Ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table
 * Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Mobile Engineers, and other highly skilled specialists
 * Passionate about quality and writing testable code that performs and scales
 * Professional programming experience with Core PHP & API integration
 * Able to write neat & clean code with good logic flow




Responsibilities
 * Build, own and generally maintain our vendor API integration microservices
 * Evolve and maintain our architecture, including monitoring and alerting systems
 * Contribute to improvements in a microservices architecture system
 * Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback to foster growth
 * Seize great opportunities, helping Happy.Rentals rise to the top of the vacation rental home and travel industries
 * Excellent written and oral communication skills in English

title: Frontend Developer REACT
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por el mejor talento dentro del sector tecnológico. Nos involucramos en una gran variedad de proyectos punteros, trabajando con las últimas tecnologías. Actualmente en BETWEEN contamos con un equipo de más de 800 personas.

Trabajamos en ámbitos como BI, IoT, Big Data e I+D. En el área de Operaciones implantamos proyectos de Service Desk, Infraestructuras IT y proyectos Cloud, entre otros.

Actualmente seleccionamos un Frontend Developer con REACT para incorporarse de forma indefinida en uno de los equipos que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes.

La persona seleccionada participará en el desarrollo de software para la industria textil. Buscamos una persona con experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones web, con un profundo conocimiento de React y TypeScript, enfocado en el rendimiento, y con experiencia en desarrollo basado en pruebas (TDD) y familiaridad con las tecnologías de backend, en particular Python y Flask.

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:

 * Desarrollarás y harás el mantenimiento de interfaces de usuario utilizando React.js.
 * Construirás componentes reutilizables y bibliotecas front-end para uso futuro.
 * Traducirás diseños y wireframes en código de alta calidad.
 * Optimizarás componentes para un máximo rendimiento en una amplia variedad de dispositivos y navegadores web.
 * Colaborarás con el equipo de backend en la definición de APIs y protocolos de comunicación.
 * Escribirás y mantener pruebas unitarias y de integración con React Testing Library.
 * Participarás activamente en el ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software (planificación, diseño, desarrollo, pruebas, y despliegue).
 * Proporcionarás recomendaciones técnicas para mejorar la eficiencia y el rendimiento del software.
   
   

Beneficios que tendrás en tu lugar de trabajo:

 * Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo (reuniones presenciales bisemanales).
 * Flexibilidad horaria.
   
   

Además, trabajando para BETWEEN obtendrás los siguientes beneficios añadidos:

 * Seguro médico incluido por ser Betweener
 * Posibilidad de formar parte de una empresa en pleno crecimiento a nivel nacional e internacional. Un buen lugar donde trabajar: cuidamos de nuestro equipo y la sociedad a través de iniciativas, programas de conciliación y de responsabilidad social corporativa
 * Te integrarás en un equipo de alto rendimiento y con un alto grado de especialización.
 * Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional
 * Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
 * Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible, y descuentos para acceder a centros de fitness, entre otros
 * En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.
   
   

Requisitos:

Imprescindible:

 * Experiencia mínima de 2 a 4 años en el desarrollo de aplicaciones web.
 * Amplio conocimiento y experiencia con React.js y TypeScript.
 * Experiencia con React Testing Library.
 * Conocimiento de desarrollo basado en pruebas (TDD).
 * Familiaridad con la gestión del estado de React (Redux, Context API).
 * Experiencia en optimización de aplicaciones web para maximizar la velocidad y la escala.
 * Conocimientos sólidos en programación orientada a objetos y principios SOLID.
 * Familiaridad con los últimos estándares de ECMAScript.
 * Comprensión sólida de CSS y preprocesadores CSS como SASS o LESS.
 * Conocimientos en sistemas de control de versiones como Git.
   
   

Valorable:

 * Experiencia o conocimientos en Python y Flask.
 * Familiaridad con las metodologías ágiles como Scrum.

title: Software Backend Developer Internship
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
We are looking for innovators!

At HP, we are committed to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere. Do you have a thoughtful idea with the power to change the world? If so, we want you onboard!

By doing your Internship with HP, you will become part of a worldwide community of engineers, designers, and business professionals that develop cutting-edge technology and solutions with the power to transform the way we create, communicate, decorate or advertise in many industries and shapes.

At HP Barcelona we host 12 businesses and are the worldwide HQ of the 3D Printing and the Large Format Printing businesses as well as the largest HP R&D Lab outside of the US and a fantastic Demo center.

The Large Format Printing GBU is responsible for the business strategy, product portfolio and research and development for all HP Large Format Printing products at WW level, including HP DesignJet, HP PageWide XL, HP Latex and HP Stitch printers. HP leads this very dynamic market by bringing continuous innovation to our customers.

Keep reading to know how you can be part of this community and become one of our innovators:

About The Role

This is a great opportunity to join Large Format Software Solutions team as an intern

You’ll Be Responsible For

 * Contributing to the design, development and maintenance of the tool that generates configuration files for the creation of Large Format drivers.
 * Designing, contributing solutions development
 * Agile, continuous integration and test-driven oriented development is desired.
 * Project tracking and documentation
   

About You

 * Currently studying Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science Telecommunications, Electrical or similar fields.
 * Availability to establish internship agreement with University during 3 to 12 months, either on a part-time or full-time basis.
 * Availability to start early November 2023
 * Basic understanding of backend frameworks, preferably C#.
 * Demonstrated ability to work with a group of peers.
 * Good written and verbal communication skills in English
   

Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.

 * You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
 * Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 6 to12 months agreement
 * Lunch in the cafeteria
 * Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash, basketball and yoga
 * A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as “beer bust” Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
 * We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
 * Free printing Happy hour – from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology – from wall covers to 3D printed models
   

Sounds like you? Please apply and let’s talk!

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

description:
🤔 Short Description: A Full Stack Developer is in charge of developing our products. To do so you’ll be part of an international team, bringing you support and guidance in your journey. This position is key for the growth of Payflow.

👀 Requirements: We are looking for an experienced developer, with challenging experiences and the capacity to make beauties from scratch. We are looking for a motivated, hard-working, resilient, and a team player person who is hungry to participate in growing the next successful Y Combinator and Rocket Internet venture.

🗣 Language requirements: Fluent English + Spanish is a plus

📌Location: Barcelona

And what makes Payflow unique?

The 21st century is the start of the on-demand revolution. Booking an Uber takes 2 seconds from your phone. Ordering a Glovo takes 5 seconds. Starting your favorite series takes an instant on your TV. And now, accessing your salary can be the same.

Payflow’s mission is simple - we aim to bring financial wellbeing to everybody through financial education and access to fair and socially responsible financial products - offering employees the revolutionary social benefit that allows them to access their earned wages instantly, rather than waiting until payday.

Is it challenging? Of course yes 🎯 Are we ready to do whatever it takes to make it happen? Yes - to the moon and beyond 🚀 Want to be part of this amazing team? Join us!

Ok, but what is FullStack Developer about?

Our FullStack Developer will be part of an international team (more than 10 nationalities). Making things happen across the Tech department. You will be mentored by our VP of Engineering and exposed to a wide variety of topics related to the application, the dashboard or integrations.

More Specifically, Some Of The Key Tasks Are

DEVELOP THE APP’S NEW FEATURES. We are aiming to have the most complete financial wellbeing app of the market, let’s make it true with your skills and develop high value features! BUILD INTEGRATIONS WITH HR SOFTWARES. Our strength is to go live with all the possible HR software to ensure our client the quickest onboarding possible DEVELOP OUR DASHBOARD. Give better tools for HR departments to retain their talents and take the constant temperature of the financial wellbeing of their employees

In short, Full Stack Developer is a key role that requires a strong capacity of adaptation to high intensity development and a will to own from A to Z projects. You are part of the frontline of Payflow success and will be among the first 20 employees to build the future of employee benefits in Spain and abroad.

What do we offer?

Full-time contract with competitive base salary 45 k€+ (based on experience) A brand new computer, your choice of Mac or PC The opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and be one of the first twenty employees. There is plenty of room for personal and professional development. A clear career plan so that if you perform well, you can get promoted If you perform well, we may reward you with additional employee benefits (e.g. ‘flexible benefits’) Be part of one of first 5 start-ups in Spain to be part of Y-Combinator and help us to continue in hyper growth mode, in Spain and beyond Somewhat flexible working environment (occasional remote work, etc.) The opportunity to collaborate building Payflow's brand and express your personality The opportunity to learn a lot. If you are ambitious and like winning, there is no better place to grow and improve A young and ambitious team that knows when to work but also when to have fun (company events, weekly lunches, beers😀🍻, etc.) Off-site events to celebrate (e.g. ‘Retreats’) when we meet our objectives as a team

Sounds cool! What are we looking for?

More than everything else, we are looking for someone excited to join us in reaching our challenging objective. We are working hard to reach our goals, and we expect you to do the same!

In details, here the key skills we would love to hear from you:

English speaker, Spanish is a plus and legal right to work in Spain A strong entrepreneurial mindset 4+ years of relevant experience, ideally in startups A strong entrepreneurial mindset and the drive to do whatever overall Deep understanding of Node.js, MySQL and API development Good understanding of React or Angular (or similar) Experience with AWS and Docker Experience writing unit and integration tests Ideally experience in integrating with HR, Payroll or banking software Ideally experience with mobile framework such as iconic or react native Ideally experience with Typescript Sense of urgency and ability to multitask Attention to detail Interest in social impact, employee benefits and/or payments technology Willingness to take our product to the next level! 🔥

The Process We Use Is The Following

1st round: 1 hour - Tech call with VP of Engineering and a peer from the Tech team.

2nd round: Technical exercise - Take-home test.

3th round: 1 hour - Tech call with 2 other peers from the Tech team.

Want some TIPS for your interview? We like winning! And we want you to be the same! That’s why our core values spell TIPS.

Sounds weird? Here the whys:

Try: Say ‘yes’ before ‘no’ ✅

Improve: Never Settle 🚀

Push: Work hard but smart 🤓

Smile: Good vibes only 😊

We are building a company based on these values, and we want you to know them in advance!

Other details

Contract type: Full-time contract in Spain

Location: Barcelona or Madrid

Start date: As soon as possible! (if you want a date, it would be yesterday!)

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
If you like challenges and enjoy owning your code from design to production this is your opportunity!




At Smadex we are looking for a Full Stack Engineer with hands-on experience in Angular2 and Node js.




 * Design and develop front-end and back-end components for our web applications.
 * Build and maintain public APIs using RESTful design principles and best practices.
 * Knowledge of security best practices for APIs, such as OAuth2 and JWT.
 * Experience with server and network architecture, with strong proficiency in front-end and back-end development technologies.
 * Ensure high performance and responsiveness of our web application, ensuring the API is reliable and error-free.
 * Familiarity with public API development tools such as Swagger and OpenAPI.
 * Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to other team members.




Smadex is a cutting-edge ad-tech company: we process more than 2,5 million ad requests per second, replying under 100ms. Every day we generate several TBs of data that need to be processed, analyzed and aggregated, so our real-time components get smarter every day. Our tech stack is 100% based on AWS, running thousands of instances and containers in 7 different regions.




What will you do at Smadex?




 * Learn from every step in the software development process under the “You build it, you run it” philosophy: owning your code from design to production; testing, deploying and monitoring.
 * Design and implement complex and scalable web applications, like the Smadex Web Application and third-party APIs.
 * Time is gold: help optimize the user experience and the application performance.
 * Participate in code reviews, design proposals, collaborate in a fast-paced environment where every opinion counts.




If you become a team member, you will get the chance to:




 * Have a real impact on one of the hottest ad-tech in Barcelona and Europe.

title: JavaScript Frontend Engineer
description:
Web3 UX isn’t good. WalletConnect will make it good: we are the open-source web3 standard to connect blockchain wallets to dapps. Any wallet, any dapp, any chain. Starting in 2018, our mission is to make web3 accessible to everyone. Every month, millions of people use WalletConnect in thousands of integrations. We raised ~$25M from venture investors including 1kx and Coinbase as well as from customers such as Shopify and Circle. We are growing fast both in terms of features and users.




The Role




We’re looking for a frontend aficionado with passion for the smallest details to help build delightful web experiences for millions of users. This includes framework neutral tools such as web3modal.com which are served by other developers to end users as well as WalletConnect products such as web3inbox that are directly served to end-users. In order to delight developers, you will play an instrumental role in developing framework-neutral tools that can be consumed by apps building on React, Vue, VanillaJS, and more.




Responsibilities:




 * Work closely with our design team in the conceptualization & ideation of new products/features
 * Think deeply about and deliver a compelling end-user UX
 * Deliver software in TypeScript using web components/React/NextJS
 * Translate designs from Figma into modular, reusable and optimized UI components
 * Bring in your own ideas on how to make our products better
 * Lead your own initiatives from ideation to delivery




Requirements




Must have:




 * 3+ years of experience as frontend developer
 * Strong portfolio of delightful web applications
 * Solid written/async and verbal communication skills

Nice to have

title: Software Engineer (Solutions Team)
description:
A Little Bit About Flanks




Flanks is a Barcelona-based fintech company focused on wealth management services. Its main product is a SaaS solution that helps financial advisors, family offices, private banks and other institutions to have a holistic view of their clients’ financial assets while using the latest scraping technology. We’re currently building the benchmark in the Open Wealth industry, and so far, we managed to have compatibility with over 280 custodian entities.




Thanks to our clients, we continue to grow at a fast pace. We have multiplied our growth by six, built a presence in 11 different countries in the last 18 months. In August 2021, Flanks raised €2.3 million in an investment round led by JME Ventures and SeedRocket 4Founders Capital to accelerate our market expansion.




In order to accelerate our market expansion in Europe and Americas, we would like to count on you to also grow (personally and professionally) with us.




Flanks’s Values Are




 * People first: To us, the most important thing is for “Flankers” to feel at ease, for them to get involved in a project and feel part of the team.
 * Keep growing: Our team believes that people growing in lockstep with the company is essential, both personally and professionally.
 * Think twice, act once: We like to think about all the possible consequences for taking any decision that could affect the team or our clients.




If you’re looking to grow professionally in a very fast-growing company with an exciting start-up culture, this is your opportunity!




About The Role




You'll be working as a full member of the Solutions Team, participating in the design, planning and execution of new features and the maintenance of the current ones. The team is responsible for most of our customer facing and internal products.




This is a generalist role. This does not mean we expect you to know absolutely everything. You will have your areas of expertise and things you’ll like more than others. However, you will be exposed (and sometimes deeply working) on all layers of the stack: from the front-end to our APIs, databases and even infrastructure.




You will be expected to lead small initiatives on your own and to sustain a high level of quality in your work. Support and training will be provided, but you should have learning skills and the ability to do research on your own.




This is not a full-remote position. Although most of the time you will be able to work from whenever you want, it is expected to come to the office by your own means a few times a month.




Things we'd love to see on you




 * A few years of programming experience, preferably in Python or Javascript.
 * You have worked on projects with other people and have experience with Git.
 * Likewise, you are a team player and a good communicator. You focus on communication over resolution.
 * Experience working with databases, both SQL and NoSQL.
 * Working English and Spanish proficiency.
 * In general, the more experience with parts of our stack, the better. However, we're looking for the fundamentals, so don't worry if you don't tick all the boxes.
 * You are a nice person. Toxic behavior and bigotry will not be tolerated.




Our current tech stack




 * Python on our back-end, migrating to async-based for most parts.
 * Vue in our front-end.
 * Running on GKE
 * Powered by MongoDB and PostgreSQL
 * Also, Redis, RabbitMQ, Jenkins, GitHub and other usual suspects.




What We Can Offer




A non-exhaustive list of perks includes:




🏠 Office at 5 minutes from Pl. Espanya and Sants Estació




🔆 Flexible working hours,




🎊 Paid time off on your birthday




🍒 Fresh fruit every week, all-you-can-drink tea and coffee




🍻 Friday happy hours after our monthly team meetings (optional)




😎 Team building events (optional)




🙀 Personal holidays swap inside the same month




🏥 Health insurance




💸 Flexible remuneration with Cobee




📚 Yearly training budget




The hiring process




 * You send us your resume, cover letter, etc.
 * A chat with the team manager, where we’ll dive deeper into your background, your possible fit, and where you’ll have the opportunity to ask any sort of questions.
 * A coding test, to take at home at your own time and with your own setup and tools. We will be flexible here, and if you already have some code suitable for discussion, we can use it.
 * A technical interview, including a review of the code assignment. No whiteboard or tricky algorithm questions: just a chat to sample the breadth and depth of your knowledge.
 * A meeting with our direction team (CTO and/or CEO).
 * Optionally, any other meeting you or us might need to clarify any pending questions.
 * We send you an offer.




If you think you meet most of the criteria described above, don’t hesitate to send us your CV and/or cover letter. We will be happy to hear from you!




Flanks is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion both in our hiring practices and in our experiences as a Flanks employee. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and encourage all applicants regardless of race, religion, or belief (if any), nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, sexual orientation, age, marital and civil partnership status, or disability status.

title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
description:

As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining web + mobile applications. We also don’t take ourselves too seriously, though - it’s all about enjoying the journey. Being a member of MVST means being passionate about our industry, digital products, and their power to change human behaviors.

title: Frontend React Engineer
description:
Whitespectre is a product-centric, technology consultancy for both VC funded start-ups and large, established companies across the US and Europe. We’re also a product incubator with our own applications and B2B SaaS platform. As long-term partners to our clients, we’ve played a critical role in their growth- both through the products we co-create and the expertise and processes we bring. Proudly remote first since 2013, we’re a close-knit team of 75, working in fast-moving, cross-functional agile pods to solve interesting technical challenges and drive real business impact.




What's it like to be a Frontend Engineer at Whitespectre?




 * Our Frontend Javascript developers are sharp technical experts with the ability to think like product owners- being able to advocate for code quality as a long term strategic investment while knowing when to adapt a more start-up mentality to deliver rapid business value. They drive architecture and implementation decisions, mentor other engineers, and stay up to date with the latest Javascript techniques and trends as part of the collective Whitespectre Javascript brain trust.
 * Whitespectre operates on a fully-modern tech stack- toolset includes React, Typescript, REST/GraphQL, Node.js/Next.js/Express, etc. Working smartly is important to us; automation, dynamic environments spin up with new feature branches and slack bot integrations control our production releases (CI/CD, AWS, Github workflows)
 * We follow an agile 2-week sprint methodology with Product, UI/UX and Engineering within the team to align closely with business stakeholders and incrementally build and release new functionality
 * The majority of our projects involve building greenfield applications and our delivery teams typically own products end to end - your thinking and contribution make a big impact!
 * You can read more about life in our Javascript engineering team in this post by our Senior Engineer, Eneko.




Benefits




 * Competitive salaries, with payment in USD
 * Annual Performance & Salary Reviews, with proactive career management
 * 20 Days PTO & 3 Charity Days annually
 * Funded face-to-face meet ups in Barcelona, as well as, South America and Asia
 * Assisted Relocation package
 * Flexible working hours for efficient teaming in a 100% remote environment (proudly remote-first for 10 years!)
 * Free English classes & educational expenses support
 * Generous Employee Referral Plan
 * Team Fitness and Charity Initiatives




Cultural Benefits




In addition to the above benefits, we foster an inclusive working environment that provides:




 * Great company environment - check out Glassdoor
 * Personalized onboardings
 * Opportunity to contribute to company-level initiatives
 * Work with a broad range of best-in-class technologies
 * Cross-company knowledge groups - improve your expertise, share your learnings and work with different technologies and tools
 * Regular brown bag learning sessions
 * An emphasis on Work-life balance




This is the right position for you if want




 * The challenge of collaborating with business stakeholders and Product Managers to advocate for technology solutions while bearing in mind the tradeoffs for business results
 * The responsibility of designing new architectures and being confident to justify your technology decisions. (Plus debating and recognizing when a colleague has an even better idea!)
 * The opportunity to go outside your core expertise and strengthen skills with other technologies and learn more
 * To solve problems that can’t be addressed by just searching Stack Overflow
 * An environment where excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) are valued and honed
 * A culture where people from different backgrounds interact, collaborate and reach a shared goal




The “check The Box” Requirements




 * 4+ years of experience as a Javascript Software Developer. 3+ years with React.js and 1+ year of experience with React Native
 * Advanced English level, excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Experience contributing to technical decision-making within a team
 * Can work full-time with a significant crossover with the core hours: 11am - 7pm Central European Time
 * Live outside of the US. Please, no recruitment agencies.




Interested in applying?
 * Apply by completing the form below - and we’ll get back to you. Candidates enjoy meeting our Javascript Technical Leads and discussing interesting coding challenges as part of our selection process
 * Or email us with any questions on recruiting@whitespectre.com
 * Our process includes the following:
    * A 30 minute video call with our Talent Acquisition team to understand your experience & expectations
    * A 60 minute technical interview to explore your technical capabilities
    * Final interview(s) with the company leadership to confirm fit & finalize your offer

title: Software Engineer - JavaScript (Remote in Spain)
description:
About us:




Have you always wanted to put your passion for education to use on the job? Would you like to work with an incredible team making an impact on learning around the world? If you answered yes, we can't wait to meet you!




We’re looking for our next Software Engineer - JavaScript to join the Engineering Team in Spain. And just who are we? Edpuzzle is a leading edtech company with offices in San Francisco and Barcelona and nearly 10 years of history helping teachers find and create exciting, interactive video lessons. Over 80% of U.S. schools and millions of teachers and students in 190+ countries around the world are already using Edpuzzle to make education more equitable and engaging.




Wondering what it’s like to work at Edpuzzle?




Picture a place where you can connect with your teammates, whether remotely or in person, whenever you need support. A place where one day you're helping shape one of the biggest edtech platforms in the world, and the next day you're doing a teambuilding activity with your coworkers. A place where everyone has been selected because they're the best at what they do, and where your manager and team trust your decisions fully. A place where you're encouraged to learn and grow because education is the cornerstone of everything we do. Check out the job details below to see if Edpuzzle could be the right fit for you!




What technologies will you find?




Technically speaking, we use React and Redux for our frontend and Node, Express, and MongoDB in the backend. We work with testing, hexagonal architecture, DDD, CI/CD, and deploy every day making sure we never compromise on code quality and reliability. We’re fully hosted on AWS which we also use to store, encode and stream our own pool of videos.




About the team:




Our Engineering Team is composed of Full Stack Software Engineers with different levels of seniority. This allows us to learn from each other and get to know our product in-depth, end to end, with continuous deployments twice per day, and collaborate on scalable projects to achieve challenging goals together!




About you:




 * More than 4 years of experience in front-end, back-end, or full-stack development
 * An open-minded attitude with technologies and development
 * Experience writing well-tested JavaScript code
 * Experience with at least one frontend framework (React, Vue, Svelte, etc.) and with high-traffic backend systems in any language
 * You feel comfortable communicating in English within an international and multicultural team
 * You’re excited by the opportunity of working in education
 * You make all your technology decisions with the final user in mind
 * You love learning and mastering technologies
 * You can work independently and manage goals and deadlines effectively
 * You have an excellent ability to communicate your ideas, regardless of the audience
 * You are based in Spain and have a work permit to work in Spain
   
   

Bonus skills:




 * MongoDB
 * Redis
 * Elasticsearch
 * Messaging systems like RabbitMQ, SQS, etc
 * Cloud providers such as AWS, Azure, Google App Engine, etc
   
   

What’s it like to work remotely?




 * Work from the comfort of your own home
 * Use the Edpuzzle office as much or as little as you like
 * Meet with your manager and team via video calls on Google Meet or Slack
 * Connect with coworkers via Slack (with channels for work and for fun!)
 * To enjoy our remote work policy, you’ll need high-speed internet access
   
   

What we offer:




 * Competitive salary (39K – 48K), and a yearly salary review based on performance
 * Training and development (CodelyTV, etc.), we love keeping ourselves updated!
 * Free private health insurance policy with AXA
 * €2000 annually for meals
 * Flexible remuneration for childcare and transportation
 * 24 paid holidays plus December 24th and 31st
 * Flexible working hours and reduced working time on Fridays
 * Remote-friendly: Feel free to work 100% remotely or use the Barcelona office whenever you want, for the best of both worlds!
 * Free coffee, snacks, and drinks in the Barcelona office
 * Teambuilding events during working hours
 * Incredible opportunity to grow, learn, and build lifetime bonds with other passionate people
   




Edpuzzle is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.




This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Edpuzzle makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.




References from previous employers will be requested from candidates during the selection process. If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply below. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Frontend Software Engineer - Vue
description:
About Bankable




We are on a mission to enable our customers to become ‘Bankable’ by providing a one-stop solution for embedded finance. We work with the world’s leading FinTech, corporates and financial institutions, providing them an API based platform which allows them to access financial products and embed them in their own offerings.




At Bankable, we’re building a truly global solution for payments, cards and working capital which our customers access through a single API integration platform. Partnering with Bankable allows customers to bypass the legacy banking system to build new, profitable revenue streams from financial services, whilst relying on the highest levels of security, resiliency, and scalability.




Our people are hungry for success, humble in collaborating, and are experts in their field.




Role purpose

Your team

title: Intern Software Developer at PMQ
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
description:
The Position




Purpose of the role




As Software Developer you will be developing software solutions like Chrome extensions or web apps for internal Post Market Quality (PMQ) users. PMQ is part of the Quality & Regulatory global function.




This internship will give you an opportunity to work in a small community (4 - 7 members) developing internal technical solutions for a global organization. As a member of the PMQ Solutions team, you will be working in a very transversal environment having the opportunity to work with different technologies such as JavaScript, Google Cloud Platform, Tableau, or APIs. Your main role will be software developer, and during the internship, you will be able to play, learn from different roles depending on your interest and team needs (Software Requirements, Architect, Tester, or even Product Owner) and contribute with your own ideas and proposals. You will work in an Agile environment in a team continuously improving.




How would your day-to-day look like?




A day in your life as a SW intern will start with a daily meeting together with the rest of the team. We do follow agile methodologies and that daily meeting is key in terms of team alignment. It helps the members of the team to continue working on their respective tasks in perfect sync. The team works on different projects simultaneously. You will be assigned a collection of taks to work on depending on the stage of the different projects, the sprint goals and your current responsibilities at the time. Usually, the tasks you will be working on will be defined by tasks/user stories/items available on a JIRA board. You might be involved in some activities such as coding, testing, requirement gathering, documentation, and architecture design, ... Since this is a small and quite new team, the tasks you’ll have to work on will be very diverse, giving you the opportunity to wear different hats, experience and learn about the different roles involved in SW development.




Who are you?




 * Recent graduate (max 2 years after graduation) in the fields of Informatics, Telecommunications, or Computer Science
 * Team player with the willingness to learn SW development, passionate about coding and IT
 * Some knowledge (could be academic) of web-based programming and technologies (HTML, JavaScript, CSS) and some cloud programming like GCP (Google Cloud Platform) services (firebase, google scripts, …)
 * Awareness of object-oriented design principles and algorithms
 * Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken) are essential




What do we offer?




 * Being part of a diverse and growing team that falls within an impactful global organization, such as it is the case of Post Market Quality
 * Having the opportunity to apply the skills you gained throughout your education
 * Getting hands-on experience developing Software Solutions
 * Huge investment in coding training
 * Learning from very experienced members who will be able to guide you and help with your personal development
 * Working in an international environment, letting you improve your communication skills in English




Why our team?




The Post Market Quality team is the global team under the Quality and Regulatory organization that ensures end-to-end solutions for all on-market Product Quality and Product Performance related questions. Those solutions enable accountability for Complaint Handling, Vigilance Reporting, Global Safety Board & Recall Management, and overall Post-Market Surveillance for Diagnostics.




PMQ is a DIVERSE group of 26+ nationalities with more than 20+ spoken languages. Our priority is to provide a quick resolution to our patients and customers' issues.




The PMQ Solutions team is developing exploratory solutions that allow PMQ users to improve their experience on their day-to-day.




Who we are




At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.




Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Software Engineer - Barcelona
description:
We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.

Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including AirBnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel and technology industries.

Over the past few years, we’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion— to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.

TravelPerk are innovators. During the last year we have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and of course GreenPerk we are shaping the future of the industry. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that’s where you come in!

If you’re ready to take off with us, keep reading!

Are you a Software Engineer with extensive programming experience?

We’re not looking for stack experts. We’re looking for smart people who can bring in the best tools and processes to get the job done. Read more about our engineering team in this blog post

You will work on a day-to-day basis with our product team to design, architect and implement our product. TravelPerk is a next-generation platform to take the pain out of booking and managing business travel.

As Software Engineer, This Position Involves

 * Product development in Python/Django and/or React of a travel-related web-based product
 * Integrations between our product to 3rd party APIs
 * System architecture design, implementation, and testing
 * Work in an Agile environment with strong attention to a well-documented code, unit testing, and continuous integration
 * Being able to mentor, coach, and train other colleagues as a domain expert
   

Required Skills And Experience

 * "Product Engineering" mindset
 * Pragmatism and obsession for simplicity, efficiency, and performance
 * Extensive experience in similar roles building technically complex products in any web programming language
 * An expert level at server-side, client-side or full stack development. Your final role within the team will depend on your skills and internal training will be provided
 * Obsession for quality and testing
 * Eager to learn new technologies and frameworks
 * Strong communication skills
   

Bonus Points For

 * Experience in the travel industry
 * DevOps experience with the AWS suite
 * Experience working with high-performing, Agile development teams
 * People who like to build stuff (we really like people who maintain/contribute to open source projects)
   

What do we offer?

 * Competitive compensation including equity in the company
 * Generous vacation days so you can rest and recharge
 * Health perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance depending on your location
 * "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary
 * Unforgettable TravelPerk events including to travel to one of our hubs
 * Mental health support tools for your wellbeing
 * Exponential growth opportunities
   

Our Vision is for a world where TravelPerk serves as the platform for human connection in-real-life (IRL). We take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in-person 3 days a week. As such, this role requires you to be based within commuting distance of our Barcelona hub. We fundamentally believe in the value of meeting in-real-life to improve connectivity, productivity, creativity and ultimately making us a great place to work.

For certain roles, we can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply. Do not forget to submit an updated portfolio and/or resume.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means you’re welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you’re from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

title: Back-end Developer
description:
A Little Bit About Flanks




Flanks is a Barcelona-based fintech company focused on wealth management services. Its main product is a SaaS solution that helps financial advisors, family offices and other institutions to have a holistic view of their clients’ financial assets while using the latest scraping technology. We’re currently building the benchmark in the OpenWealth industry, and so far we managed to have compatibility with over 250 national and international entities.




Thanks to our clients, we continue to grow at a fast pace. We have already more than 300,000 aggregated portfolios spread across nearly 250 entities and have positioned our business at break-even in less than a year. In August 2021, Flanks raised €2.3 million in an investment round led by JME Ventures and SeedRocket 4Founders Capital.




We are pioneers in our market in Spain, which will certainly grow a lot in the next few months and years. However, we are going to take a league leap in terms of the volumetry of the system, as our key focus now is to accelerate our market expansion in Europe and LatAm. And we would like to count on you to also grow (personally and professionally) with us.




Flanks’s Values Are




 * People first: To us, the most important thing is for “Flankers” to feel at ease, for them to get involved in a project and be feel part of the team.
 * Keep growing: Our team believes that people growing in lockstep with the company is essential, both personally and professionally.
 * Think twice, act once: We like to think about all the possible consequences before taking any decision that could affect the team or our clients.




If you’re looking to grow professionally, you’re passionate about understanding how things work, finance and helping and learning from others. This is your opportunity!




About The Role




You will be a Backend Developer in our company. You'll be working as a full member of the Drivers team, participating in the process of data extraction from various custodian entities. You will be working with Python as a basis and custom techniques and methodologies in order to make data extraction and processing at large scale. You will cooperate with technical and financial people in order to understand in detail what you’re processing.




Responsibilities




Examples of tasks you can expect to work on are:




 * Understand and automate the login process of financial institutions websites with multi factor authentication mechanisms
 * Reverse engineering of online banking websites
 * All of the steps of an ETL data pipeline
 * Data extraction from websites content, csv and pdf documents




Our tech stack




 * Python as code base
 * Browser emulation tools
 * Pandas for document data parsing
 * Jenkins as CI/CD
 * MongoDB as data storage tool




Things we'd love to see on you




 * You are a nice person: Assholes and bigotry won’t be tolerated.
 * You live in Barcelona City and/or close enough to work at the office twice/three times a week. Living in Spain is a mandatory requirement, and a non-negotiable requirement.
 * Likewise, we can’t offer a relocation package and/or working visa.
 * You have working English and Spanish proficiency.
 * You have some experience in similar roles. We're looking for someone with some lessons already learned.
 * Working experience with data pipelines and scrapping.
 * You are familiar with MongoDB.
 * Meaningful experience with Javascript will be a huge plus.
 * We will be helping you to grow, so don't worry if you don't check all the boxes!




What Can We Offer




We offer what we think is fair compensation (from 23K to 30K € per year for this role). We're on top of the market, but our intention is to increase compensation as the company grows. You will not be left behind. We believe this is a really nice time to join the project. This is a full-time, permanent contract.




A Non-exhaustive List Of Perks Includes




🏠 Office between Sants Estació and Plaça Espanya, with a 280 degree view of Barcelona.




🔆 Flexible working hours




🎊 Paid time off on your birthday




🍒 Fresh fruit every week, all-you-can-drink tea and coffee




🍻 Friday happy hours after our weekly team meetings (optional)




😎 Team building events (optional)




🙀 Personal holidays swap inside the same month




🏥 Health insurance




💸 Flexible remuneration with Cobee




📚 Yearly training budget




The hiring process




This Is How The Usual Hiring Process Looks Like




 * You send us your resume, cover letter, etc.
 * A chat with our CTO Sergi Lao, where we’ll dive deeper into your background, your possible fit, and where you’ll have the opportunity to ask any sort of questions.
 * We will send you a technical test so we can see how you deal with problems and how you manage Python.
 * A meeting with our CTO and our CEO Joaquim de la Cruz.
 * Optionally, any other meeting you or us might need to clarify any pending questions.
 * We send you an offer.




We expect a few days to pass between each step. We aim for a process as short as one week and never longer than one month.




If you think you meet most of the criteria described above, don’t hesitate to send us your CV and/or cover letter. We will be happy to hear from you!




Flanks is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion both in our hiring practices and in our experiences as a Flanks employee. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and encourage all applicants regardless of race, religion, or belief (if any), nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, sexual orientation, age, marital and civil partnership status, or disability status.

We oversee the full digitalization spectrum – from one of the industry’s largest IT infrastructure projects that includes data centers, networking and security, to application platforms that span from workplace services to digital interaction. In short, we deliver full-scale, end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age.




D&I statement

Join us. Let´s care for tomorrow.

title: Javascript Developer
description:
About us

TransPerfect helps organizations navigate the global marketplace. It remains founder-led – and has striven to maintain the ethos and drive that led them to grow organically year-on-year for the past 30 years. Starting in an NYU dorm room in the early 1990s, TransPerfect is today recognized as the largest translation and language services company in the world with thousands of employees located in 90+ offices around the world – and has exceeded $1 billion in revenue in 2021.




The TransPerfect TechOps team has been a vital part of the company’s success since its formation 10 years ago – delivering technology and services that have drastically simplified the lives of our clients and colleagues – from workflow improvements for colleagues to core services that form the basis of the company’s GlobalLink platform, to creating scalable client interfaces that allow novice users to navigate complex ecosystems.




Your responsibilities and tasks will include:

 * Code defined features, investigate and fix bugs.
 * Write Unit Tests.
 * Participate in Code Reviews.
 * Take ownership and drive end-to-end quality software development processes.
 * Ability to code following different architectural design patterns.
 * Have knowledge of multiple areas or domains of the code/product.
 * Show a constant interest in learning new things and try proof of concepts to improve the code/product.
 * Be a mentor for other engineers.
 * Actively participate in frequent code/design/architecture reviews.




The minimum we’re looking for (show us what you got if you aren’t a perfect fit):

 * 1-3 years of software development experience.
 * Proficiency in JavaScript.
 * Strong experience using VueJs ecosystem.
 * Ability to take complex designs from Figma and make the corresponding HTML/CSS/JS code.
 * Experience/knowledge of Agile methodologies like SCRUM/Kanban.
 * Knowledge of SOLID principles.
 * Knowledge of clean code practices.
 * Ability to work with complex enterprise software architectures.




Why you should join us? Let's see:

 * 💰 Competitive salary in line with your experience and knowledge.
 * 😏 You will work in a dynamic, well-functioning software development division with the world's largest provider of language services and technology solutions.
 * 📈 Significant room for growth.
 * 🎂 Enjoy a free day for your birthday.
 * 🏝 22 days of paid vacations.
 * 🥗 Ticket Restaurant.




By applying, I confirm I have read and accepted TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting




Work model:

This position is intended to be largely in-office with a focus on flexibility. Today, most of the global team is on a hybrid model ranging between 3-4 days in the office per week. We aim to find an inclusive balance between everyone's personal lives and responsibilities and the value created from in-office collaboration. We work with new team members to find that balance with them while building the trust and collaboration that our team values.

We believe that sharing the same physical space with our colleagues creates a level of trust and understanding that fosters innovation and a sense of purpose.

The socializing and relationships formed from these in-person interactions have created the bonds that make our team successful.

We not only want to encourage people to safely spend time in the office, but also, schedule regular travel between our offices in Europe and the US – and a regular conference where the entire worldwide team is gathered together. Maybe the Metaverse will replace the office some day – but it hasn't yet! Online meetings were a powerful connector during the pandemic – but they don't foster the same connection.

title: Software Developer (Mid-level) in Scale Up - Barcelona
description:
Our client




A fast growing bioinformatics startup in Barcelona working in the field of




omics sciences, offers bioinformatics cloud software, custom software




and bioinformatics consulting services for healthcare, pharma, agriculture, and




industrial biotech applications.




The role




We are seeking a mid-level Software Developer to join in the team. As




a Software Developer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining




microservices to be integrated into our IT architecture, helping the customers




send and receive health data, including patients' metadata and analysis data.




You will also be responsible for connecting the microservices in the cloud with




third-party tools to create a continuous operational workflow. This includes




designing and implementing integrations with external APIs and services,




ensuring the smooth flow of data between our system and external systems.




In addition, you will be supporting the senior full-stack developer in building and




maintaining our main cloud software.




You will work with Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, in a fast-paced,




collaborative environment. Strong communication and problem-solving skills are




essential, as is the ability to adapt to changing requirements and priorities.




Key Responsibilities




 * Design, develop, and maintain microservices to be integrated into our




cloud IT architecture




 * Integration with external APIs and services for internal operational




workflows




 * Build a healthcare system for interoperability of patient metadata, based




on HL7 content standard and FHIR transport standard.




 * Handle data distribution and access from client systems to our architecture
 * Support the senior full-stack developer in building and maintaining our




main cloud software




 * Support in developing the data transfer service to securely transfer analyses




data between laboratories and our cloud systems




 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the system meets all




requirements and conforms to industry standards




 * Continuously monitor and improve the performance and scalability of the




system




Requirements




 * Training in Degree in Computer Science, or Software Engineering or




equivalent course as Software/Backend Developer (non-mandatory




requirement)




 * Experience in web development
 * Experience in designing and building microservices
 * Experience with handling data transfer
 * Experience with data encryption is a plus
 * Required knowledge of JavaScript and Node.js
 * Nice to have knowledge in React.js and Next.js
 * Knowledge in Python or JAVA is a plus
 * Knowledge in REST APIs, data mapping, and data transformation
 * Knowledge in data transfer protocols, such as SFTP, Socket is a plus
 * Knowledge in databases SQL and NoSQL
 * Knowledge in Docker, Linux/Unix OS
 * Nice to have knowledge in Interoperability, FHIR and HL7 standards
 * Knowledge of Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum
 * Strong problem-solving and communication skills
 * Languages: Spanish and English ; Italian is a plus
 * Proactive self-starter, willing to “go the extra mile”, quick learner,




collaborative, organized, responsible, communicative, creative and open to




learn and receive feedback




Job Offer




 * Full time (40 h/week)
 * indefinite-term contract
 * flexible working hours
 * 23 workdays of vacation
 * Friday home office




If you have a passion for bioinformatics and healthcare technology and want to be




part of a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation, we want to hear from you!

title: Graduate - Software Engineering
description:
Overview

Wouldn’t it be great to join forces and use our skills to contribute to a more sustainable aviation?

We are looking for you, recent graduates, to join our new early career Program,as part of our Engineering and Technology function for an initial period of 1 year, with an opportunity to become permanent.

For us, early in career Talents are the key to the future. We want to onboard you on impactful missions alongside our experts, to empower you to grow and get valuable experiences.

As Part Of The Program, For Your 1 St , 2 Nd And 3 Rd Years In The Company You Will Get The Chance To Experience Rotations In Different Teams, Which Can Include Depending On Your Profile

 * Test and Quality Assurance
 * Development Activities (Mobile, web, back-end…)
 * Scrum Management
 * Project Management
 * DevOps
   
   

Doesn’t it sound like a great plan to launch your career?

You will be based in our Barcelona office with 50+ colleagues, as well as gain international exposure interacting with people across the company in Montreal, Geneva, London, Paris, Dubai, Singapore...

At SITA, we are meeting the new needs of travel ...today! Evolving in a unique high performing culture, combining telecommunication and Air Transport, where people do great things together.

Are you ready to join us?

Wait. You might wonder: “What do we do at SITA FOR AIRCRAFT?”

We make flight operations, air traffic management and aircraft maintenance more sustainable and efficient.

How? Enabling collaboration between people and organizations in the air transport industry through:

 * Communication – connecting aircraft and people around the world.
 * Data & Platform - Turning aircraft data into valuable insight for the entire industry.
 * Applications – Empowering the industry with user-friendly tools that make flight operations more sustainable and efficient.
   
   

What Will You Do

You will get to develop, step by step and over the months, on the following type of activities:

 * Test and Quality Assurance:
    * Produce test scripts, materials, and regression test packs to test new and amended software or services.
    * Specify requirements for environment, data, resources, and tools.
    * Interpret, execute, and document complex test scripts using agreed methods and standards.
    * Provide detailed analysis of all testing carried out on the environment ensuring all bugs, risks and issues are logged correctly.
    * Actively provide feedback to senior QA management which may result in new working practices or general QA improvements.
    * Create high level test scenarios.
    * Execute test scenarios.
    * Develop test automation frameworks.
    * Record and analyze actions and results and maintain a defect register.
    * Review test results and modify tests if necessary.
    * Report on progress to stakeholders.
    * Provide highly valued input by acting as an advocate for the customer and end users.

 * Development Activities:
    * Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code (iOS, Flutter, C++ Qt…).
    * Write and deliver code for functionality and features in application modules and debug existing code.
    * Provide proper code documentation and implement configuration changes to packaged software applications to meet business requirements.
    * Participate in analysis of requirements for designing new application and system features, and also analyze and triage defects on an as-needed basis.
    * Follow coding guidelines and practices and all technical processes.
    * Analyze the business users’ needs, to design and develop an application or leverage existing technology with customized enhancements to provide a solution.
    * Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
    * Develop and validate estimates for technical work that will be undertaken.
    * Develop new functionalities in the applications.
    * Create Unit Testing for new functionalities.
    * Develop and validate estimates for technical work that will be undertaken.

 * Scrum management:
    * Assist in guiding the team and organization on how to adopt Agile/Scrum practices processes and values.
    * Support the team on removing impediments by finding the right personnel to overcome them.
    * Contribute to building a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame retribution or being judged, with an emphasis on healing and problem-solving.
    * Facilitate discussion, decision making and conflict resolution.
    * Help to facilitate team dynamic such as the daily stand-up sprint planning, end of sprint demo and retrospective meetings.
    * Act as the conscience of the team especially when evaluating Doneness or Readiness criteria.
    * Support the team on the use of planning tools to enable tracking of progress with User Stories and Features via Sprint and Release Burndowns.
    * Assist with internal and external communication improving transparency and radiating information.
    * Act as a shield for the team from outside distractions and interferences.

 * DevOps:
    * Monitor, maintain, scale, and optimize cloud infrastructure services.
    * Perform analysis for troubleshooting and incident response.
    * Support infrastructure teams and company projects.
    * Keep our infrastructure aligned with the highest security standards.
    * Be part of our DevOps strategy.

 * Project management:
    * Support IT projects’ workload management through its life cycle.
    * Keep track of project activities against time schedules, helping to take corrective actions against any deviations.
    * Communicate effectively with team members, enhancing collaboration and aligning on how to reach business objectives.
    * Documenting project activities.
    * Assist with developing communications strategy plans, designing resource and project plans, or providing status reports, among others.
      

Qualifications

Who you are:

 * Passionate for the Air Transport Industry and Technology!
 * Curious and eager to learn how the company operates.
 * A team player that enjoys collaborating with colleagues to accomplish the best results.
 * Proactive and focused on finding solutions to the problems.
 * Someone who can easily adapt to the challenges that may arise.
 * Experienced in writing code, ideally in C++, Java, or JavaScript Frameworks.
 * Keen to maintain efficient documentation, unit tests and participate in code reviews.
 * Knowledgeable and interested in public cloud domain (e.g. Azure).
 * Experienced in the use of Linux system is a plus.
 * Experienced in the management of databases, networks, and monitoring (application, infrastructures, …) is a plus.
 * A recent graduate from a technical university, with a degree achieved related to the role.
 * A fluent English speaker - French and/or Spanish are a plus.
   
   

What We Offer

SITA’s workplace is all about diversity: many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things: smarter, quicker, easier, for us and for our customers too.

Welcome to SITA

SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.

We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Are you ready to explore the opportunities?

Keywords : Aeronautical, Sustainability, Sustainable, International, Early-in-career, Graduate, Aircraft, Telecommunication, International, Multi-cultural, Engineering, Development, Quality Assurance, Testing, Application, Airline, Operation, Air Traffic Control, Scrum Management, DevOps, Project Management,

SITA is an Employment Equity Employer and values a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, Aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process.

title: Full stack Developer (Node.js + React)
description:
Who are we? Amaris Consulting es una firma independiente de asesoría tecnológica que ofrece servicios de orientación y soluciones para las empresas.




Reúne a más de 7 500 personas distribuidas en 5 continentes y más de 60 países. Con más de 1.000 clientes en todo el mundo, hemos implementado soluciones en proyectos importantes durante más de una década.




Nuestros especialistas cubren sectores que abarcan desde servicios financieros y transporte hasta atención sanitaria y tecnología.




Amaris es su ‘stepping stone’ para atravesar ríos de cambio, afrontar retos y realizar todos sus proyectos con éxito. Job description




Encuentra tu lugar en Amaris Consulting en un nuevo proyecto como Senior Fullstack Developer trabajando en híbrido en Barcelona. Si te gustaría trabajar en un ambiente internacional y ágil, te estamos esperando.




👉 ¿QUÉ VAS A HACER? 👈




 * Participar en el diseño y desarrollo de aplicaciones web escalables y de alta calidad.
 * Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros desarrolladores, diseñadores y equipos de producto para garantizar una experiencia de usuario excelente.
 * Realizar pruebas unitarias y de integración para garantizar la calidad del código.
 * Participar en el diseño y desarrollo de arquitecturas de microservicios y sistemas de caché.
 * Realizar la integración con servicios externos y la implementación de iFrames.
 * Participar en la definición y desarrollo de herramientas y sistemas de análisis de datos y Analytics.
 * Participar en la definición y desarrollo de Design Systems y la creación de diseños y estilos consistentes.
 * Participar en el proceso de desarrollo de software mediante el uso de herramientas como Jira y Bitbucket.




✍️ ¿A QUIÉN BUSCAMOS? ✍️




 * Al menos 7 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones web y stack tecnológico siguiente: NodeJS, React, Typescript, Jest, NestJS Framework, NextJS Framework, CSS.
 * Experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de arquitecturas de microservicios y sistemas de caché.
 * Experiencia en la integración con servicios externos y la implementación de iFrames.
 * Conocimientos en herramientas como Postman, Swagger, Bitbucket, Trunk-based Development, Jira, Docker, Clean Architecture, Scrum, Design System y Figma.
 * Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar estrechamente con otros desarrolladores, diseñadores y equipos de
 * Inglés avanzado.




🚀 ¿POR QUÉ NOSOTROS? 🚀




Cuidamos Nuestros Consultores, Por Eso Podemos Ofrecer




Somos personas con sueños y motivaciones como tú, deseando trabajar en proyectos que nos proyecten a lo más alto y nos empujen a superarnos. Trabajamos al lado de gente súper talentosa con la que podemos compartir conocimientos, y experiencias, pasar el rato, y sentir el apoyo de nuestros compañeros y managers.




 * Unirte a un grupo global de rápido crecimiento con una facturación de 565M€ y más de 1.000 clientes en todo el mundo.
 * Formar parte de un entorno internacional y multicultural de 6.650 personas con talento en 60 países y 5 continentes, pudiendo beneficiarse de las oportunidades de movilidad internacional y progresar en su carrera en todo el mundo, y/o experimentar otros departamentos y sectores.
 * La flexibilidad está a la orden del día, por lo que contamos con una política amistosa de trabajo a distancia, una jornada laboral intensiva, así como con beneficios sociales como el billete de transporte, de restaurante o de guardería, y un seguro médico privado.
 * Explora las oportunidades de crecer rápidamente con una trayectoria profesional a medida y una evaluación salarial: El 70% de nuestros principales talentos senior se incorporaron a la empresa en un entry level.
 * Desarrolla tus habilidades con nuestro catálogo de Tech Academy en últimas tecnologías, acceso a la plataforma de E-learning Udemy con más de 500 cursos de formación, que incluye programas en comunicación interpersonal, gestión de equipos, gestión de proyectos, y participa en nuestros Webinars y Workshops.
 * Elige tu propio curso de formación con tu presupuesto personal anual y aprovecha las ventajas de nuestros socios obteniendo certificaciones pagadas por la empresa.
 * Siéntete parte de nuestra Comunidad formando parte de nuestras sesiones de Idiomas, Team buildings, Afterwork hangouts, y el Evento del Año.
 * Contamos con el programa WeCare, en el que la empresa ayuda a los empleados gravemente afectados.
 * Libera todo tu potencial, tanto profesional como personal.




Amaris Consulting se enorgullece de ser un lugar de trabajo con igualdad de oportunidades. Nos comprometemos a promover la diversidad dentro de la plantilla y a crear un entorno de trabajo inclusivo. Para ello, damos la bienvenida a las solicitudes de todos los candidatos cualificados, independientemente de su género, orientación sexual, raza, etnia, creencias, edad, estado civil, discapacidad u otras características.
